DOC.brief_summary: Maternal depression mother-infant relationship dysfunction reciprocal effect . An integrated approach address problem simultaneously may improve outcome . Perinatal Dyadic Psychotherapy ( PDP ) develop prevent/decrease postpartum depression facilitate optimal mother-infant relationship . The purpose pilot study determine feasibility , acceptability , preliminary efficacy PDP . Depressed first-time mother ( meet diagnostic criterion depression and/or high depression symptom level ) 6-week-old infant randomize receive either PDP intervention control condition . The PDP intervention consist 8 home-based , nurse-delivered mother-infant session consist ( ) supportive , relationship-based , mother-infant psychotherapeutic component , ( b ) developmentally base infant-oriented component focus promote positive mother-infant interaction . Control mother receive usual care plus depression monitoring phone . Data collect baseline , post-intervention , 3 month follow-up . Assessments include maternal depression ( diagnosis severity ) , maternal anxiety ( diagnosis severity ) , parent stress , mother-infant interaction .
